tool_description: Generates appropriate primary keys for database entities, choosing between natural keys, surrogate keys, and composite keys based on entity characteristics.

entities.description: List of entities needing primary key assignment

entity_attributes.description: Attributes for each entity in format 'entity.attribute'

prefer_surrogate_keys.description: Whether to prefer surrogate keys over natural keys

key_naming_convention.description: Primary key naming convention: id_suffix, pk_prefix, or entity_name

error_messages: Empty entities list: Provide at least one entity for primary key generation.
Mismatched attributes: Ensure entity_attributes correspond to provided entities.
Invalid naming convention: Use one of [id_suffix, pk_prefix, entity_name].
Insufficient attributes: Each entity must have at least one attribute for key generation.
usage: Provide entities and their entity_attributes arrays. Optionally set prefer_surrogate_keys and key_naming_convention. Returns primary key assignments for each entity.

key_types.description: Type of each primary key (natural, surrogate, composite)

key_data_types.description: Recommended data types for primary key columns

auto_increment_keys.description: Keys that should use auto-increment functionality
